Reviews.Title: Great Phone, be careful of your model and the misleading description
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: First off -- I love this phone. The gaming controls are awesome to have and I use this for playing emulators mostly. I purchased this phone and am using it with Straight Talk.One thing to note! The description says this is an unlocked phone...this is a bit misleading because the phone is just "sim unlocked" which means you can use another sim card in the phone for a different carrier such as T-Mobile or Straight Talk. The phone itself still has AT&T; firmware/software on it so you will see the AT&T; boot up screen and there will be some unremovable applications on the phone that new AT&T; phones are programmed to have. They don't bother me and don't take up much space, but it would be nice if they weren't there in the first place.Another thing to note is that you can't get into the bootloader settings on this phone...so if you want to really change some settings on this phone or easily root it, you will have to do some more tricky stuff at the risk of bricking it.One of the downsides to this phone on Straight Talk is that I can only connect to the Edge network (2G) and not 3G in my area (which is supported). The reason for this is because I can't get into settings on the phone to change my network carrier to 3G T-Mobile (which is what I would use for data under Straight Talk)...I could do this if the phone was actually UNLOCKED, but it's not... Be wary of this if you are looking to buy the phone.I should also note that the phone I received was a model r800at, not r800a as listed (if it really matters).The phone itself runs pretty fast. Like I said, if you are looking at emulators with this phone, it's totally worth it, even with no 3G in my opinion. I have WiFi at home and work, and 2G is good enough for me when I'm traveling so I don't complain. My phone did not come with a 8gb mircosd card or headphones like a retail package. I ended up buying a 32gb card which is nice. Nintendo 64 emulated games will run a little slower depending on the game and Playstation games depend on the emulator, but that just gives you an idea of how well it can run games that aren't even meant for the platform.The phone could use more internal memory (512mb isnt much with so many new and big apps) and I found myself moving everything I could to the SDCard and installing smaller sized app alternatives. The battery could also last a lot longer, but I think I may buy a 3400mah version. The phone comes with a 1400mah battery.

Reviews.Content: My review about the phone is 5 stars to it.. Sony Ericsson created a very practical phone for a gamer.. so no complains with it, but I was reading the "what is in the box" notes outside the box and the 8gb sd card with the pre-loaded games is not inside.. really frustrated for this....

Only problem is my nephew decided to root the phone and he didn't know what he was doing and now its a brick paper weight, great until then though.

Reviews.Title: Nice portable gaming device, not as nice as a phone
Reviews.Author: camilo soto
Reviews.Content: I've had the phone for about a month now, here are my impressions so far:PROS:* the screen colors are bright and images look nice and crisp, the resolution is pretty good.* plays Game Boy advance games perfectly through an emulator, haven't tested the PS one emulator yet* the gamepad feels nice and is perfect for RPG type games that don't require super fast precise responsesCONS:* as a phone it's quite outdated, it's very sluggish when using skype or pretty much anything other than an emulator* battery life is extremely short, even if the phone is just idling it hardly gets though 8 hours at times, had to buy a second battery and external charger to have a backup at hand.* gamepad is not usable enough for fast paced action games, shoulder buttons are hard to reach and hard to hit precisely* internal storage is fairly small and a lot of it comes used up by preinstalled games that you cant uninstall without rooting the phone.Overall, I wish they'd make an updated version of this phone, with better specs it would make for an excellent phone and a perfect portable console for emulators, as it stands, it lack a lot as a phone by today's standards, only buy it if you really want to play a lot of emulated games on a decent gamepad and don't mind a slow phone.

Thank you so much, alot better than having a gophone backup from att.... an xperia by att....in awesome condition! 5 stars, truthful. Decently priced. Condition - like new...no lie. Delivery - quick and convenient.Again thanks so much!  Jonathan W.

Reviews.Title: AT&T; all over this phone, misleading description

I had to open an account with AT&T; for my son so he can use the phone; he loves it, but I am trying to convince him to send it back and get try the really UNLOCKED, unused, in the original SEALED Box.

Reviews.Author: R. Frederick
Reviews.Content: Ordered the Unlocked R800a.  Instead I received the locked R800at.  Luckily I use AT&T; but it is a pain in the ass to try and unlock the R800at.  If you are buying this phone with the intention of getting root access (which you need to get rid of the ridiculous amount of bloatware this phone comes with), make sure you are getting the R800a.

ProductInfo.Features:
This unlocked cell phone is compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T; and T-Mobile. Not all carrier features may be supported. It will not work with CDMA carriers like Verizon Wireless, Alltel and Sprint.
4G-enabled, Android 2.3-powered PlayStation gaming smartphone with slide-out game controls, and 4-inch multi-touch screen
1 GHz processor; Wireless-N Wi-Fi networking; Bluetooth connectivity; GPS navigation
5-MP rear camera/camcorder; VGA front camera for video chats;personal and corporate e-mail
Up to 7.4 hours of talk time, up to 350 hours (14.5 days) of standby time; released in September, 2011
ProductInfo.Name: Sony Ericsson Xperia PLAY 4G R800a Unlocked Phone with Android 2.3, 5MP Camera, GPS and Wi-Fi - Stealth Blue U.S. Version
